availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mathew Henry Turner (Adair Co, Kentucky, farmer; pvt & lieut 1st Ky Lt Art & 13th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Turner and Catharine Turner. Farmer in Columbia, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and lieutenant from October 8, 1861, to January 8, 1863. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, District 1, p. 67.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 357.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0147.
